definition: immerse briefly into a liquid so as to wet, coat, or saturate, a gymnastic exercise on the parallel bars in which the body is lowered and raised by bending and straightening the arms
details:
verb
- immerse briefly into a liquid so as to wet, coat, or saturate
= example: immerse briefly into a liquid so as to wet, coat, or saturate
= synonyms: dunk
- to plunge one's hand or a receptacle into a container
= example: to plunge one's hand or a receptacle into a container
- immerse in a disinfectant solution
= example: immerse in a disinfectant solution
- place (candle wicks) into hot, liquid wax
- to partially or totally submerge into a liquid
= example: to partially or totally submerge into a liquid
= synonyms: duck, douse
- slope downwards
= example: slope downwards
- appear to move downward
= example: appear to move downward
= synonyms: sink
- lower briefly
= example: lower briefly
- switch (a car's headlights) from a higher to a lower beam
= synonyms: dim
- take a small amount from
= example: take a small amount from
- stain an object by immersing it in a liquid
- go down momentarily
= example: go down momentarily
- dip into a liquid while eating
= synonyms: dunk
- scoop up by plunging one's hand or a ladle below the surface
= example: scoop up by plunging one's hand or a ladle below the surface
noun
- a gymnastic exercise on the parallel bars in which the body is lowered and raised by bending and straightening the arms
- a brief swim in water
= synonyms: plunge
- a candle that is made by repeated dipping in a pool of wax or tallow
- a sudden sharp decrease in some quantity
= synonyms: fall
- a brief immersion
- tasty mixture or liquid into which bite-sized foods are dipped
- a thief who steals from the pockets or purses of others in public places
= synonyms: pickpocket, cutpurse
- (physics) the angle that a magnetic needle makes with the plane of the horizon
= synonyms: inclination
- a depression in an otherwise level surface
= example: a depression in an otherwise level surface
